sections.title: Dermal fillers with medical oversight
sections.body: Dermal fillers can restore volume and soften lines for suitable patients. We’ll discuss risks, alternatives and realistic outcomes.
bullets: Assessment-led planning with photos and facial mapping
Product selection matched to area, mobility, and desired support
Escalation protocols with dissolving enzyme available if needed

sections.title: Measured volume, mapped anatomy
items: Treatment delivered by a clinician trained in facial vascular anatomy and complication management
Use of CE-marked fillers from regulated suppliers with documented batch tracking
Needle or cannula chosen per area to limit vessel trauma and bruising
Hyaluronidase and emergency pathways on standby for rare vascular events

sections.title: Safety-first planning for balanced restoration
sections.body: We review your goals, medical history, and facial structure before suggesting filler. If appropriate, we map areas such as cheeks, lips, chin, or tear troughs and agree conservative volumes. Alternatives like skin boosters (/treatments/skin-boosters) or polynucleotides (/treatments/polynucleotides) are offered when better suited.
bullets: Baseline photos and proportion checks to avoid overfilling
Discussion of product choice, anticipated longevity, and maintenance
Consent covering risks including swelling, bruising, and vascular compromise
Clear plan for staged treatment rather than large single sessions

sections.title: For patients needing structural support
items: Age-related volume loss in cheeks or mid-face when replacement is appropriate
Lip definition or contouring with conservative volume
Jawline or chin support for profile balance
Patients willing to follow medical guidance on maintenance and safety checks

sections.title: Assess, treat, review
items: Consultation: suitability review, photography, and treatment planning
Treatment: controlled filler placement with aseptic technique and aspiration where indicated
Review: post-treatment check to assess integration, comfort, and symmetry
Maintenance: guidance on intervals, with dissolving as an option if we need to reverse
sections.strapline: Longevity varies by product and area. We avoid excessive volume in one sitting to protect tissue health.

sections.title: Layered placement with product matched to purpose
sections.body: Fillers are selected for cohesiveness, lift, and flexibility based on treatment area. We document depth, plane, and volume per point, using cannulas for glide when helpful and needles for precision where appropriate.
sections.mediaHint: Hyaluronic acid filler with cannula and needle options

sections.title: Stay monitored with clear safety advice
items: Expect temporary swelling or tenderness; bruising is possible for several days
Avoid makeup, saunas, or strenuous exercise until advised
Urgent guidance provided on signs of vascular compromise (severe pain, blanching, or colour change)
Follow-up appointments to review feel, symmetry, and whether maintenance is required

faqs.question: How long do fillers last?
faqs.answer: Most hyaluronic acid fillers integrate over days and may last 6–18 months depending on area, product, and lifestyle.

faqs.question: Can fillers be dissolved?
faqs.answer: Yes. If clinically indicated, hyaluronidase can reverse hyaluronic acid fillers. We keep this available and explain the process before treatment.

faqs.question: Will it look overdone?
faqs.answer: We favour subtle changes and staged sessions. Photography and proportion checks help us avoid overfilling.

faqs.question: Is there downtime?
faqs.answer: Most patients resume light activities the same day. Swelling or bruising can last a few days; we provide aftercare and check-ins.

faqs.question: Can fillers be combined with other therapies?
faqs.answer: Often yes, with careful sequencing. We may pair fillers with anti-wrinkle treatment (/treatments/anti-wrinkle-treatments) or skin boosters (/treatments/skin-boosters) when appropriate.

sections.title: When this fits and what else to consider
sections.body: In our clinic we usually stage this after facial aesthetics consultation (/treatments/facial-aesthetics) so the plan stays safe and measured.
bullets: Appropriate when you want to understand how dermal fillers can be used safely and what outcomes are realistic.
Often follows Facial aesthetics consultation (/treatments/facial-aesthetics); Routine skin health checks (/treatments/preventative-and-general-dentistry).
Alternatives we balance: Anti-wrinkle pathways (/treatments/anti-wrinkle-treatments); Dermal fillers (/treatments/dermal-fillers).
Next steps we plan for: Skin boosters (/treatments/skin-boosters); Polynucleotides (/treatments/polynucleotides); Therapeutic injectables (/treatments/therapeutic-facial-injectables).

sections.title: Book a facial therapeutics consultation
sections.strapline: Discuss whether conservative dermal filler treatment is right for you with a clinician who keeps anatomy, safety, and reversibility front of mind.

ctas.label: Plan a clinician-led dermal fillers review
